action.action-desc: Mr. Downing (for himself, Mr. Meuser, Mr. Ogles, and Mr. Sessions) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To impose limitations on the amount of unobligated balances of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the CFPB Budget Integrity Act.

section.header: Limitation on unobligated balances of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection

subsection.text: Section 1017(a)(2) of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5497(a)(2)) is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: For a fiscal year, the amount of unobligated balances of the Bureau may not exceed 5 percent of the dollar amount referred to in subparagraph (A)(iii). The Director shall transfer any excess amount of such unobligated balances to the general fund of the Treasury.

subsection.header: Report on use of unobligated balances
subsection.text: Section 1017(e)(4) of such Act (12 U.S.C. 5497(e)(4)) is amended by inserting (including a description of the use of any unobligated balances) after funds of the Bureau.
